Toll Creagach

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Toll Creagach is an undistinguished dome-like summit between Glen Affric and Loch Mullardoch, with shallow corries on its flanks.

 You have not climbed Toll Creagach.

Region: Loch Ness

Altitude: 1054 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 2.67/5
Rating: 2.7/5 (52 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Toll Creagach and Tom a' Choinich from Glen Affric

Other routes and challenges

The summit can be reached by easy walking from the top of Doire Tana / Mhor to the east; this can be reached via a stalkers' path from the south, or from the Mullardoch dam.

For the truly superfit, the massive challenge hereabouts is the complete Mullardoch round, following ridges that can take in up to 12 Munros, usually accomplished as a lightweight backpacking route.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Glen Affric Hotels

Glen Affric B&B

Glen Affric Cottages

Loch Ness Hostels
